title: Installing a package with a new compiler causes directory to be created with the wrong group ownership
body:
Installing a package with a new compiler causes directory to be created with the wrong group ownership. 

### Steps to reproduce the issue

```
ecptestb@thetalogin1:/lus/theta-fs0/software/spack/spack-dev/opt/spack/cray-cnl8-mic_knl> ll
drwxrwxr-x 6 spack    software 4096 Apr 19 16:47 gcc-8.2.0
ecptestb@thetalogin1:/lus/theta-fs0/software/spack/spack-dev/opt/spack/cray-cnl8-mic_knl> spack install spack-dummy-package %intel@18.0.0.128 
==> mpich@3.1 : has external module in cray-mpich
...
==> Successfully installed spack-dummy-package
  Fetch: 0.25s.  Build: 2.25s.  Total: 2.50s.
[+] /lus/theta-fs0/software/spack/spack-dev/opt/spack/cray-cnl8-mic_knl/intel-18.0.0.128/spack-dummy-package-refactor-yebephikrhqwmc36r2xtrrt7uobwllyx
ecptestb@thetalogin1:/lus/theta-fs0/software/spack/spack-dev/opt/spack/cray-cnl8-mic_knl> ll
drwxrwxr-x 6 spack    software       4096 Apr 19 16:47 gcc-8.2.0
drwxrwxr-x 3 ecptestb **ecp-testbed-01** 4096 Apr 19 20:56 intel-18.0.0.128
ecptestb@thetalogin1:/lus/theta-fs0/software/spack/spack-dev/opt/spack/cray-cnl8-mic_knl> ll intel-18.0.0.128/
total 4
drwxrwsr-x 4 ecptestb software 4096 Apr 19 20:56 spack-dummy-package-refactor-yebephikrhqwmc36r2xtrrt7uobwllyx
```

The package installed and has correct group (software) ownership within the subdirectory, but the parent intel-18.0.0.128 directory is created with the wrong group ownership (user's default group). 

The packages.py file declares the group and permission settings which are handled correctly for the final installation directory, just not the intermediate. 
```
packages:
  all:
    permissions:
      write: group
      group: software
```

### Information on your system

Cray XC-40 theta at ALCF
